page.title: 10Farming-Commercial-Ingliston
page.content: The farms of upper and lower Ingliston are owned by the same family and are farmed as one unit. They are situated in the south easterly part of our area. They cover 250 acres and were bought by the Morrison family in 1933. Two brothers farm the land without employing any other labour. The main enterprise is fattening sheep although they also fatten about 50 cattle per year and grow nearly 100 acres of barley. The Messrs Morrison permanently have 50 breeding ewes and 9 tups. The lambs from these Suffolk and North Country Cheviots are joined by 300 lambs bought in at the end of the harvest for fattening during the winter. The fattening cattle are bought in as store cattle at a year old. The barley is sold as grain or for malting
